synopsis: In the first part of their engaging discussion on breakups, hosts Devam and Ahir share their personal experiences and insights on the emotional rollercoaster that often accompanies the end of a relationship. They explore the importance of self-reflection, the healing process, and the value of open conversations about mental health, all while encouraging listeners to embrace their feelings and seek support from friends and family.
quotes: Healing means to feel whole by yourself, to not be constantly thinking about someone or something.
Sometimes, to love means to let go.
It's easy to hold on to the things that give you the most comfort, but you have to move on.
Feelings are real; if you push them down, they will come out in bad ways.
Being around couples can be tough, but it's important to respect your feelings and the journey you're on.
You can't avoid the fact that you're going to feel resentful sometimes, and that's perfectly understandable.
Every moment is an opportunity to start fresh and create your own identity.
It's okay to take it one day at a time; healing is a continuous effort.
Ask for help when you need it; it's often the hardest thing to do but can make all the difference.
Music can validate your feelings in ways that nothing else can.
